segment.source: Files, folders, and libraries
segment.target: Files, folders, and libraries

segment.source: Files, folders, and libraries
segment.target: Files, folders, and libraries

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: You use the APIs in the Windows.Storage, Windows.Storage.Streams, and Windows.Storage.Pickers namespaces to read and write text and other data formats in files, and to manage files and folders.
segment.target: You use the APIs in the Windows.Storage, Windows.Storage.Streams, and Windows.Storage.Pickers namespaces to read and write text and other data formats in files, and to manage files and folders.

segment.source: In this section, you'll also learn about reading and writing app settings, about file and folder pickers, and about special sand-boxed locations such as the Video/Music library.
segment.target: In this section, you'll also learn about reading and writing app settings, about file and folder pickers, and about special sand-boxed locations such as the Video/Music library.

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Enumerate and query files and folders
segment.target: Enumerate and query files and folders

segment.source: Access files and folders in either a folder, library, device, or network location.
segment.target: Access files and folders in either a folder, library, device, or network location.

segment.source: You can also query the files and folders in a location by constructing file and folder queries.
segment.target: You can also query the files and folders in a location by constructing file and folder queries.

segment.source: Create, write, and read a file
segment.target: Create, write, and read a file

segment.source: Read and write a file using a StorageFile object.
segment.target: Read and write a file using a StorageFile object.

segment.source: Get file properties
segment.target: Get file properties

segment.source: Get properties—top-level, basic, and extended—for a file represented by a StorageFile object.
segment.target: Get properties—top-level, basic, and extended—for a file represented by a StorageFile object.

segment.source: Open files and folders with a picker
segment.target: Open files and folders with a picker

segment.source: Access files and folders by letting the user interact with a picker.
segment.target: Access files and folders by letting the user interact with a picker.

segment.source: You can use the FolderPicker to gain access to a folder.
segment.target: You can use the FolderPicker to gain access to a folder.

segment.source: Save a file with a picker
segment.target: Save a file with a picker

segment.source: Use FileSavePicker to let users specify the name and location where they want your app to save a file.
segment.target: Use FileSavePicker to let users specify the name and location where they want your app to save a file.

segment.source: Accessing HomeGroup content
segment.target: Accessing HomeGroup content

segment.source: Access content stored in the user's HomeGroup folder, including pictures, music, and videos.
segment.target: Access content stored in the user's HomeGroup folder, including pictures, music, and videos.

segment.source: Determining availability of Microsoft OneDrive files
segment.target: Determining availability of Microsoft OneDrive files

segment.source: Determine if a Microsoft OneDrive file is available using the StorageFile.IsAvailable property.
segment.target: Determine if a Microsoft OneDrive file is available using the StorageFile.IsAvailable property.

segment.source: Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries
segment.target: Files and folders in the Music, Pictures, and Videos libraries

segment.source: Add existing folders of music, pictures, or videos to the corresponding libraries.
segment.target: Add existing folders of music, pictures, or videos to the corresponding libraries.

segment.source: You can also remove folders from libraries, get the list of folders in a library, and discover stored photos, music, and videos.
segment.target: You can also remove folders from libraries, get the list of folders in a library, and discover stored photos, music, and videos.

segment.source: Track recently used files and folders
segment.target: Track recently used files and folders

segment.source: Track files that your user accesses frequently by adding them to your app's most recently used list (MRU).
segment.target: Track files that your user accesses frequently by adding them to your app's most recently used list (MRU).

segment.source: The platform manages the MRU for you by sorting items based on when they were last accessed, and by removing the oldest item when the list's 25-item limit is reached.
segment.target: The platform manages the MRU for you by sorting items based on when they were last accessed, and by removing the oldest item when the list's 25-item limit is reached.

segment.source: All apps have their own MRU.
segment.target: All apps have their own MRU.

segment.source: Access the SD card
segment.target: Access the SD card

segment.source: You can store and access non-essential data on an optional microSD card, especially on low-cost mobile devices that have limited internal storage.
segment.target: You can store and access non-essential data on an optional microSD card, especially on low-cost mobile devices that have limited internal storage.

segment.source: File access permissions
segment.target: File access permissions

segment.source: Apps can access certain file system locations by default.
segment.target: Apps can access certain file system locations by default.

segment.source: Apps can also access additional locations through the file picker, or by declaring capabilities.
segment.target: Apps can also access additional locations through the file picker, or by declaring capabilities.
